Hey there {{NAME}},

We are glad you joined us!

One more step and you are ready,

you just need to click the following link in order to join {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}

Activate your account

Greetings from {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}!

user_pending_email.body:
Hey there {{NAME}},

You have requested to change your email address from {{CURRENT_EMAIL}} to {{NEW_EMAIL}}.

Please click on the link below to confirm your new email address.

Confirm email address change

Greetings from {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}!

user_lost_password.subject: Reset your password - {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}
user_lost_password.body:
Hey there {{NAME}},

This is your reset password link: Reset Password

If you did not request this, you can ignore it!

Greetings from {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}!

user_payment.subject: Payment received - {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}
user_payment.body:
Hey there {{NAME}},

This is a confirmation that your payment has been received by us.

Your account plan is now paid until {{PLAN_EXPIRATION_DATE}}!

You can also check all the payments you made, change your plan or cancel it.

Greetings from {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}!

user_plan_expiry_reminder.subject: Your plan is expiring in {{DAYS_UNTIL_EXPIRATION}} days - {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}
user_plan_expiry_reminder.body:
Hey there {{NAME}},

This is a simple email to remind you that your {{PLAN_NAME}} plan is going to expire in {{DAYS_UNTIL_EXPIRATION}} days.

Please renew your plan if you wish to continue using our website with all the features you have.

Greetings from {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}!

Hey there,

You have been invited by {{USER_NAME}} ({{USER_EMAIL}}) to join the {{TEAM_NAME}} team on {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}.

Click here to login and accept the invitation.

Greetings from {{WEBSITE_TITLE}}!

Click here to register and accept the invitation.

Welcome to {{NAME}} ({{EMAIL}}) to your website!

{{NAME}} ({{EMAIL}}) user just paid {{TOTAL_AMOUNT}} {{CURRENCY}} to your website!

Here's to more earnings!

pages.title: Pages
pages.subheader: Here you can find useful page resources depending on your needs.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.p1: This is the documentation for %s, a web analytics platform that is friendly, easy to use with the features that you need to keep track your websites.
introduction.p2: These help pages are created to specifically get in more detail of how the website works and how you can benefit from our functions that we provide.
introduction.p3: If you believe that what you read on these help pages is not enough or that you have any other questions, please do not hesitate to contact us.

setup.title: How to add your website
setup.p1: The setup process is very simple and intuitive, here is how to do it.
setup.step1: Make sure you have an account, you are logged in and that your plan is active.
setup.step3: Click the Add Website button and a simple form will appear.
setup.step4: Fill in the Name of your website, a simple identifier for you. It does not matter to us what you write in this box.
setup.step5: Select the protocol that your website uses, http or https. We recommend using https and making sure your website has an SSL Certificate.
setup.step6: Fill in the Website field with your website domain, subdomain or domain path. Ex: domain.com, subdomain.domain.com, domain.com/path.

install.title: How to install the tracking script
install.header: How to install the tracking script
install.p1: The installation process for our script is straight forward as it only requires you to place a simple JavaScript code in your website.
install.p2: Afterwards, with this code, all your website visitors will load the script in the background from your website and give us all the needed details to do our magic and give you the analytics that you need.
install.step1: Make sure you are logged in to your account.
install.step2: Go to your websites list that you added.
install.step3: Click on the Tracking code button and a simple modal will appear.
install.step4: Click on the Copy Pixel button or select and copy the code from the textbox area.
install.step5: Place this code in the header of your website, right before the end of the </head> html tag.
install.step6: Click on the Verify installation tab and then click the button. If you see an alert box saying that the pixel is installed, then you finished the installation process.

lightweight_tracking.title: Lightweight tracking
lightweight_tracking.p1: We have developed the lightweight tracking mode for people who care more about privacy and want a simple and performant tracking solution.
lightweight_tracking.pro_4: No tracking consent is needed as it doesn't store any personal identifiable information
lightweight_tracking.pro_5: It doesn't use cookies nor local storage,
lightweight_tracking.con_1: You can't associate a visitor with previous visits

advanced_tracking.title: Advanced tracking
advanced_tracking.p1: We have developed the advanced tracking mode for people who want more in-depth analytics and want to discover more about their visitors behaviour.
advanced_tracking.con_2: Needs more data to be sent, depending on what modules are activated

goals.title: Goals
goals.p1: First of all, you need to understand the concept of a goal. A goal is something that you want to track that the already existing analytics are not trackingâ€”anything from a button click, downloads, specific page view, like a thank-you page after a checkout...etc.

pageview.p1: The pageview goal is the easiest to set up and the conversion of the goal will happen once a visitor reaches a certain specified page.
pageview.p2: A good example would be when you have a 'thank you' page after the conversion happened (newsletter, purchase, form submission...etc) where the user will land on after.

custom.p1: Custom goals will require some extra code implemented to the tracked website, which is specified when you create a new goal from the dashboard.
custom.p2: A custom goal is mainly used for when you want to track a specific event that happens on your website, which can't be tracked with the pageview method.
custom.p3: Some examples of where custom goals will shine are:
custom.li3: Tracking clicks on specific parts of your pages
custom.li4: Any other custom action that javascript can listen to and you want to track
custom.p4: Here is what a javascript snippet would look like for goal tracking:
custom.p5: When this code will trigger inside of your page, the goal conversion will be triggered as well on our side.

custom_parameters.title: Custom parameters
custom_parameters.p1: If you wish to identify your visitors via custom parameters, then here is how you can do that.
custom_parameters.p2: This feature can be helpful when you have a website that has a membership system where users can log into your website. If they are logged in, you can specify their identifier (ex: email, user_id, name..etc) with our tracking code.
custom_parameters.p3: Why? This becomes very helpful when trying to understand what your users are doing and what problems they encountered on your website.
custom_parameters.p4: You can do this by simply adding data-custom-parameters='{JSON_PARAMETERS_HERE}' like in the following example:
custom_parameters.p5: If that extra parameter is provided then, in the Visitors page you will see the icon near the visitor which tells you that that specific user has been identified with custom parameters.

opt_out.title: Opt-Out
opt_out.p1: We do take privacy and your privacy seriously and we provide you and your users the ability to opt-out of any website that uses our tracking system.
opt_out.p2: If you are a website owner that uses our tracking services then, we highly recommend you to provide the following option for your users to be able to opt-out of the tracking.
opt_out.p3: The opt-out process is straight forward and can be done by simply accessing any website that has our tracking code installed and adding the following query parameter in your browser: ?pixel_optout=true
opt_out.p4: So if your website is https://domain.com/ and you have our pixel tracking code installed, you and your users can opt-out of the tracking by accessing the following URL https://domain.com/?pixel_optout=true.
opt_out.p5: By doing this, we set a local storage variable in your browser that tells our pixel tracking code to stop and do not further execute. Clearing your local storage, changing the browser or running the site in incognito will enable tracking again as the Opt-Out variable is not set anymore.

dnt.title: Do Not Track
dnt.p1: Yes, we do honor the Do Not Track (DNT) setting from browsers which support this.
dnt.p2: Do not track is a setting from your browser which, after you enable it, it will tell the sites that you visit that you do not want to be tracked. Unfortunately, it is not very well supported by browsers as of yet but if we receive this header setting from your browser, we are honoring it!
dnt.p3: What if you want to track everyone and skip the DNT setting? It is possible to do that as well if you are a website owner.
dnt.p4: To ignore the DNT and to also track those visitors, simply add data-ignore-dnt="true" like in the following example:

faq.p1: Some of the most asked questions and their quick answers.
faq.q1: Will the pixel tracking code slow down my website?
faq.a1: No. It does not slow the website at all as the javascript code is running asynchronously and waits for the page to be ready until it executes and starts the tracking process.
faq.q2: Why are some visitors excluded from tracking?
faq.a2: There are some cases where a visitor can be excluded from tracking:
faq.a2li1: Visitor has a browser which has JavaScript disabled
faq.a2li2: Visitor has a browser which has localStorage disabled or not working
faq.a2li3: Visitor has a browser/browser plugin that is blocking tracking
faq.a2li4: Visitor has a opted-out of tracking from your website

index.title: User session analytics
index.subheader: Easy and friendly analytics. Track your users journey, replay sessions, collect heatmaps & more.

analytics.name: Analytics
analytics.subheader: Have you ever felt like you have too much information in front of you and don't know what it means? We are providing you a clean and simple interface with easy to understand analytics.

visitor_behaviour.name: Visitor behaviour
visitor_behaviour.subheader: Understanding your users is key to learning how to improve your website. Check each visitors path and what they are doing on your site without intruding they're privacy.

realtime_data.name: Realtime data
realtime_data.subheader: Curious to see realtime data? You can check and how many users are online, which devices are the most popular and what pages are most accessed.

privacy.name: Privacy
privacy.header: We never sell your data, you own it!
privacy.subheader: Why would you get a service like this compared when Google analytics is available? Because your data matters, we never sell your data and you are in full control of it. You can delete it at any time!

session_recording.name: Session recording
session_recording.subheader: This is simply the best way to see a visitors journey throughout your website. What they click, where they're going and what they like and do not understand. You can easily replay their sessions and see exactly what they did.

heatmaps.name: Heatmaps
heatmaps.subheader: Heatmaps is a very easy to use feature to test out pages on your website and understand which parts are the most used by a collection of users on your website.

testimonials.subheader: Testimonials from people that have used our product.

error_message.no_access: You do not have access to the API.
error_message.rate_limit: You reached the limit of requests in one minute, please wait.
error_message.not_found: The resource you are looking for does not exist.

api_documentation.title: API Documentation
api_documentation.subheader: This is the documentation for the available API endpoints, which are built around the REST architecture. All the API endpoints will return a JSON response with the standard HTTP response codes and need a Bearer Authentication via an API Key.

authentication.subheader: All the API endpoints require an API key sent by the Bearer Authentication method.

filters.page: The page number that you want results from. Defaults to 1.
filters.results_per_page: How many results you want per page. Allowed values are: %s. Defaults to %s.
filters.search_by: What field are you searching by. Allowed values are: %s.
filters.order_by: What field to order the results by. Allowed values are: %s.
filters.order_by_type: The ordering of the results. Allowed values are: ASC for ascending ordering, and DESC for descending ordering.

statistics.type: Type of data to be returned. Allowed values are: overview, paths, referrers, referrer_paths, countries, cities, operating_systems, device_types, browser_names, utms_source, utms_medium_campaign, screen_resolutions, browser_languages, goals. Defaults to overview.
statistics.country_code: Parameter only available for the cities type.
statistics.utm_source: Parameter only available for the utms_medium_campaign type.

websites.excluded_ips: Exclude IPs from tracking. Enter comma separated values.
websites.events_children_is_enabled: Track visitor events (mouse clicks, resizes, scrolls, form submissions). Allowed values are: 0 or 1. Only available for normal tracking type.
websites.sessions_replays_is_enabled: Session replays. Allowed values are: 0 or 1. Only available for normal tracking type.
websites.email_reports_is_enabled: Email reports. Allowed values are: 0 or 1.
websites.is_enabled: Website tracking status. Allowed values are: 0 or 1.

affiliate.title: Affiliate
affiliate.subheader: Easiest way to earn commission from people that you bring to the platform.

commission_percentage.subheader_once: Earn commission from the first payment of any user that you bring to the platform.
commission_percentage.subheader_forever: Earn commission from all of the payments of any user that you bring to the platform.

minimum_withdrawal_amount.subheader: Once your approved balance reaches the minimum withdrawal amount, you can request a withdrawal.

how.one_help: Simply register for an account on our platform.
how.two_help: Start promoting your referral link and bring new users.
how.three_help: Once your referred users start paying, you'll get paid as well.
how.four_help: Request a withdrawal and you'll get paid.

cta.subheader: Create an account and start in just a few minutes.

email_reports.p1: Here is a short analytics overview of what happened on the %s website.
